title: Non-convergence of some non-commuting double ergodic averages
abstract:
Let $S$ and $T$ be measure-preserving transformations of a probability space
$(X,{\mathcal B},\mu)$. Let $f$ be a bounded measurable functions, and consider
the integrals of the corresponding `double' ergodic averages:
\[\frac{1}{n}\sum_{i=0}^{n-1} \int f(S^ix)f(T^ix)\ d\mu(x) \qquad (n\ge 1).\]
We construct examples for which these integrals do not converge as
$n\to\infty$. These include examples in which $S$ and $T$ are rigid, and hence
have entropy zero, answering a question of Frantzikinakis and Host.
  Our proof begins with a corresponding construction for orthogonal operators
on a Hilbert space, and then obtains transformations of a Gaussian measure
space from them.
